column2: sometimes called '''Seta Teiji''' in the West) (1916-1979) was a Japanese Haiku poet and an expert in Japanese literature. He translated several of "[[J.R.R. Tolkien|J.R.R. Tōrukin]]"'s works into Japanese
column5: ''[[Letters from Father Christmas]]'' and ''[[Bilbo's Last Song]]''. He also translated several of [[C.S. Lewis]]' works.
